name: Blueface
overview:
Blueface is an Irish provider of Voice over IP telephony services. The company was founded by Aaron Clauson in 2004 and has since seen a regular and steady growth in the Irish market. Blueface provides call plans for residential and business customers, along with VoIP and geographical numbers. Blueface sells ATA and IP phones. Blueface email to fax / fax to email service is also popular.

Blueface is committed to delivering cutting edge, innovative solutions which enable our customers’ businesses and offer huge cost savings. With a range of high-performance and fully customizable Managed Communication Services, Blueface offers an end-to-end communications solution to specialised and Enterprise-level customers. Delivery of Unified Communications technology offers feature-rich solutions for both landline and mobile requirements, as well as real cost savings for the customer.

Blueface have numerous awards for their innovative advertising and business achievements, including two Radio Awards (2006 & 2007), and Intertrade Ireland Seedcorn Competition Award (2006).

TIMELINE • Founded in 2004 in Dublin, Ireland; • Proprietary technology platform built with on-going strong commitment to R&D, supported by Enterprise Ireland; • Recognised with Deloitte Technology Fast 50 Awards 2011 and 2012; • Hardware partnership with Panasonic Europe for the supply of high-quality IP terminals; • Mobile Service launched by an Taoiseach in March 2012 in conjunction the H3G Ireland (part of the Hutchinson Whampoa Group); • Retail Partnership with Carphone Warehouse Plc. to market and distribute Mobile and Landline services;

“Our aim at Blueface is to help businesses cut costs and maximise efficiency by supplying cost-effective and innovative solutions for business communications. We are focused on continuing to find new and exciting ways to enable our customers to operate as effectively as possible, with a strong emphasis on high-performance customised deliveries”
Alan Foy, Blueface CEO.
